<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 722, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = |2x - 9|\) and \(y = 5x - 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 528, 144, 547]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 528, 448, 547]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|2x - 9| = 5x - 3.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 547]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 100, 603, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 2x^{3} + ax^{2} - 3x - 4,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 621, 145]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant. It is given that \((x - 4)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 159, 146, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 159, 514, 178]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and hence factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 159, 920, 178]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 798, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation \(\mathrm{p}(\mathrm{e}^{3\mathrm{y}}) = 0\) has only one real root and find its exact value.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[349, 88, 672, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 308, 920, 344]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curves \(y = \sqrt{2\pi - 2x}\) and \(y = \sin^2 x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\). The shaded region is bounded by the two curves and the line \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 355, 443, 375]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 355, 920, 375]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express \(3 \sin 2\theta \sec \theta + 10 \cos (\theta - 30^\circ)\) in the form \(R \sin (\theta + \alpha)\) where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\). Give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
